intro: Eumachia lophoclada, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are typically ovate or elliptical with a slightly hairy surface. Eumachia lophoclada thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
